required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HIV Outpatient Monitoring Evaluation Through Self-collection of Dried Blood Spots
clinical_study.official_title: HIV Outpatient Monitoring Evaluation Through Self-collection of Dried Blood Spots

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will assess the feasibility of self-collected DBS at home for adherence monitoring in PWH by comparing self- vs. clinic-collected DBS for the quantification of TFV-DP and FTC-TP.
Aims:
1. To compare self vs. clinic collection of dried blood spots (DBS) for the quantification of tenofovir-diphosphate (TFV-DP) and emtricitabine-triphosphate (FTC-TP).
2. To assess the acceptability, capability and preference of at-home DBS self-collection.

detailed_description.textblock:
Persons with HIV (PWH) receiving care at the uchealth infectious diseases clinic will be enrolled in the study at a routine clinic visit where blood collection is planned as standard of care. Once consented, demographic and clinical data will be obtained. Clinical data that will be collected from participant and medical records will include: age, gender, race, ethnicity, medication history, duration of ARV therapy, visit labs (e.g., hematocrit, CD4 count, HIV VL), and self-reported adherence.
Blood from venipuncture will be collected in EDTA at the time of their clinic visit, which will be transported to the Colorado Antiviral Pharmacology Laboratory (CAVP) for dried blood spot (DBS) processing, storage, and analysis. In addition, participants will be provided with necessary materials for at-home self-collection of DBS, including 903 Protein Saver Cards, lancets, gauzes, pre-packed alcohol swabs, band aids, storage bags, desiccant and pre-paid, pre-addressed mailing envelopes for the self-collection (supplies for 3 attempts will be provided). They will receive a short, in-person training for sample collection, handling and mailing (including a web-accessible instructional video and an instructional handout that the participant can view at their leisure). Participants will also be provided with a short paper questionnaire to respond to at home, which will investigate preference, acceptability and capability of DBS self-collection.
Participants will be asked to spot 2-3 drops of blood onto a provided DBS card within 24 hours of their clinic visit, discarding the first drop of blood. Collection date and time will be documented on the DBS card. Verification of collection time by research personnel will be done via FaceTime or timestamped video of DBS self-collection (i.e., directly observed self-collection). The rationale for self-collecting DBS within 24 hours of the clinic visit is TFV-DP concentrations are expected to be comparable given the 17 day half-life.
After spotting, participants will allow the DBS card to dry for at least 2 hours (up to overnight) and will mail the DBS card in the provided pre-addressed mailing envelopes to CAVP within 24 hours of collection. Upon receipt in CAVP, DBS cards will be stored at -80Â°C until analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Tenofovir-diphosphate (TFV-DP) Concentrations in Dried Blood Spots
primary_outcome.description: Drug concentrations (tenofovir-diphosphate (TFV-DP)) in dried blood spots (DBS) will be quantified and compared between clinic-collected and home-collected samples.

primary_outcome.measure: Emtricitabine-triphosphate (FTC-TP) Concentrations in Dried Blood Spots
primary_outcome.description: Drug concentrations (emtricitabine-triphosphate (FTC-TP)) in dried blood spots (DBS) will be quantified and compared between clinic-collected and home-collected samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of Fingerstick Self-Collection of Dried Blood Spots as Measured by the Acceptability of Intervention Measure
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability will be assessed using the Acceptability of Intervention Measure (AIM). The AIM consists of four questions. For each question, responses range from 1-5, with 1 = completely disagree and 5 = completely agree. The responses to the four questions are then averaged to get an overall acceptability score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of Fingerstick Self-Collection of Dried Blood Spots as Measured by the Feasibility of Intervention Measure
secondary_outcome.description: Feasibility will be assessed using the Feasibility of Intervention Measure (FIM). The FIM consists of four questions. For each question, responses range from 1-5, with 1 = completely disagree and 5 = completely agree. The responses to the four questions are then averaged to get an overall feasibility score.

intervention.intervention_name: Fingerstick collection of dried blood spots
intervention.description: Directly observed self-collection of dried blood spots via fingerstick at home

study_pop.textblock: Study subjects will be invited to participate in the HOME-1 study by enrolling a convenience sample of PWH on TDF or TAF-based therapy who received their care at the University of Colorado Hospital (UCH) Infectious Diseases Group Practice (IDGP) and are attending a clinic visit for routine care where blood collection is planned.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-89 years
- Receiving TFV (as TAF or TDF) and FTC based antiretroviral therapy for the treatment of HIV
- Current patient at the UCH IDGP clinic
- Able to comply with study procedures, including directly observed self-collection of DBS via fingerstick and completion of survey
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active hemolysis or symptomatic hemoglobinopathies
- Inability to provide informed consent
- Unable to comply with directly observed self-collection of DBS (e.g., unavailable or unable to use video streaming or recording technology)
